# canGoToFirstPage

**Instance Property**

Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the user can navigate to the first page of the document.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var canGoToFirstPage: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

The return value will be [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] unless the view is already displaying the first page.

## Related Documentation

- **goToFirstPage(_:)**: Navigates to the first page of the document.

## Determining Valid History Operations

- **canGoBack**: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the user can navigate to the previous page in the page history.
- **canGoForward**: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the user can navigate to the next page in the page history.
- **canGoToLastPage**: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the user can navigate to the last page of the document.
- **canGoToNextPage**: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the user can navigate to the next page of the document.
- **canGoToPreviousPage**: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the user can navigate to the previous page of the document.
